page.title: 16DAIRY FARMING
page.content: DAIRY FARMING We visited 2 dairy farms in our area, they were each between 100 and 200 acres. This size of farm can support a herd of between 100 and 200 cows. The herds are generally Friesans but there were some Jersey cows. The farms were owned by the farmers as is generally the case rather than renting. The farmers have also built up their farms by buying land, new buildings and increasing the size of their herds. Some of the land is used to grow grass which is cut to make into silage. The grass is cut and piled up into a mound and then covered to protect it from the weather. The grass is then preserved by a controlled process of fermentation; the sugars are converted to acids which then act as a preservative. The silage is then fed to the cattle during the winter.
